_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The things for which arising, vanishing,: Whatever form has passed, ceased, and perished
Whatever feeling has passed, ceased, and perished
Whatever perception has passed, ceased, and perished
Whatever choices have passed, ceased, and perished
Whatever consciousness has passed, ceased, and perished
Whatever form is not yet born and has not yet appeared
Whatever feeling is not yet born and has not yet appeared
Whatever perception is not yet born and has not yet appeared
Whatever choices are not yet born and have not yet appeared
Whatever consciousness is not yet born and has not yet appeared
Whatever form has been born and has appeared
Whatever feeling has been born and has appeared
Whatever perception has been born and has appeared
Whatever choices have been born and has appeared
Whatever consciousness has been born and has appeared
